alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lakeshore Flood Advisory issued March 03 at 3:45PM EST until March 04 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...LAKESHORE FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Minor lakeshore flooding. * WHERE...Wayne County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Some water on low lying roads and property along the lakeshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East to northeast gales of around 35 knots with gusts to 40 knots at times and waves of 6 to 8 feet are anticipated in the western basin of Lake Erie through this evening. As a result, water levels at Fermi are expected to rise above 61 inches above low water datum during that time. For Wayne County, the greatest water level rises and chance for lakeshore flooding will be in the far southern portion of the county.
info.instruction: Residents on or near the shore should take appropriate action to protect property from rising water levels.
